It is also a couple of blocks away from the harbor, where there are shops, great food, boat trips and the Aquarium. The customer service is excellent. The breakfast is superb. The location just cannot be beat. The rooms are charming and comfortable. Your stay at the Inn will be unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Jfooks
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in Aug,'06 at the Inn at Harbor Steps in Seattle probably the most surprising hotel stays my wife and I have had in years. Great downtown location to reach, by walking, each of the popular locations: 8 minutes from Pike St. Market, 15 to Westlake Center or Pioneer Sq, 25 to Chinatown. At about $150 per night for a large, quiet, King bed, hi ceilinged room, with landscaped courtyard view the real surprises come with the extras. A buffet breakfast (included in the rate) that is more like table service than buffet. A young kitchen staff cooking eggs, meats, potatoes, and quiche for the steam tables as quickly as they are consumed by the guests. Great coffee, pastries, etc. Then there is afternoon wine, coffee, tea, cheese service in a small pleasant Library room...again on the house. A small fitness center, sauna, and heated inside swimming pool also available for guests. When I asked for directions to the pool the desk also asked if I would like a pair of slippers. Add a free paper at the door each morning, heavy cotton bathrobes, and a small fridge in the room with a single free bottle of water & coke. Yes, a coffee maker and coffee and tea packs. There's more, but enough is enough. The stay was so pleasant that I tipped the helpfull desk clerk like one does at 5 star concierge service hotels. It will be our choice until they are acquired some day by a name brand.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but there were some issues”
Reviews.Author: new2vegas
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews posted here and had such high expectations for this hotel. First the good things: (1) the rooms were beautiful, ours included a balcony that overlooked the steps not the inner courtyard. (2) the pop and water in the fridge were a very nice touch (3) breakfast was very good--fresh fruit, quiche, breads. There were trays available in the event you wanted to return to your room. The things that I disliked: (1)check in: ---While this might sound petty to some---we arrived early and were told that check in was not until 3 pm and to come back. We arrived back around 3 and were told that they were still cleaning the room and reminded yet again that check in was not until 3 pm. While we waited the desk checked in others that were arriving. At nearly 4 we were finally permitted to check in. I have found that when a hotel knows a guest is in town early they will attempt to have your room cleaned ASAP so that you will be able to check in. You have to sign a form that states if you do not return the room keys you will pay some fee (25-75$--i cannot recall the exact amount.)--which just seemed tacky, in light of the clients that this chain attracts. Not all rooms are in the tower which houses the breakfast/front desk/pool/library. Its not a far walk, but if it is raining it means getting wet carrying your food back to your room. (2) wine and food in afternoon ----this was a wonderful touch, except they never replenished the food--even such items as crackers or cheese. Additionally, getting clean plates were hit and miss--when we asked the staff for plates we were told that he'd 'have to wash some" and then he disappeared. He never returned with any dishes. It appeared that if you did not get to the function at the start time you may or may not get any food or have any plates to put it on. ----also a note for people with food allergies--the dishes were not labeled (even with names of the dishes) so it might be difficult to determine if you can eat the item.

Reviews.Title: “Another pleasant stay...”
Reviews.Author: FarWest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this inn about a year and a half ago and had a wonderful visit to Seattle. I was so very pleased to see that nothing has changed, except for spiffy new carpets in the halls. The reception from staff was warm, even though I arrived at 10:50 p.m. The architecture of the inn is clean, contemporary and bright. The use of overstuffed furniture and warm colors added to the fuzzy feel upon arrive. In the room everything was right ... just as I had remembered. There's so much attention to detail â€¦ from the beautiful bed clothes and chocolates on my pillow, to the amazing toiletries and FREE beverages. The room was impeccably clean and well maintained. In the morning I was surprised to find such a bountiful breakfast! Although I ate at the inn on my previous stay, clearly there's bees some additional upgrading, no? Who could possibly expect to get a complete breakfast, complimentary? I have to admit, I went back for a second helping of hot, freshly cooked eggs. Ultimately, what makes a stay at this inn better than the rest is the staff. They are all so helpful and cheerful, lead by an extremely pleasant innkeeper, I might add. His name is Greg and if you have the chance itâ€™s worth having a quick chat with him. Heâ€™s a truly delightful chap. I had to leave the inn at 4 a.m. for an early flight and found the front desk agent eager to arrange transport and cheerfully wishing me a happy and safe journey. The Inn at Harbor Steps gave me a crisp contemporary environment with all the indulgent luxuries of a traditional bed and breakfast (there was no escaping those cuddly teddy bears). Being so close to the convention center and tourist attractions is a real bonus, too. I walked to a nearby (12 blocks) restaurant on my final night and stayed out â€˜til midnight! The weather was spectacular and the stroll back to the inn was a real treat. Thanks for another wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Inn at Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: mariesul
Reviews.Content: We were somewhat disappointed in the Inn at Harbor Steps in Seattle. We are well traveled B&B lovers and thought that this inn would have a little more warmth than the other massive hotels in the area. It was very modern and the furniture in the room was sparse. It was definately missing something - no ottoman, lots of empty space. The reception area was OK, but again, very cold. The location was just OK, but not safe to walk around after dark, which again was disappointing. I took a shower at night & found there to be no COLD water - which meant a very uncomfortable, scalding hot shower! When I brought it up with the front desk, another guest overheard & she said that she had the same thing happen to her - their response was "wow, that's wierd, usually it's the opposite & there's nor Hot water" - nice. AQlso, the cheapest sheet that I have ever seen in a hotel room, they were nearly see through! The breakfast was nothing to write home about - it was just OK. Mostly a continental fare. There was also very limited seating - not enough for everyone & so we had to leave then come back in order to sit down. After traveling to this inn I would not return again, nor would I reccommend them to others. I would prefer to stay in a nicer, warmer, even if larger, hotel. I don't mind spending more on quality!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: MsMcG
Reviews.Content: Recently nine friends from all over the country congregated at the Inn at Harbor Steps for a 5-night stay while we took in the Seattle sights. The location is perfect! We walked to shopping, Pike Place Market, the waterfront, and the ferry line to Bainbridge Island. Our rooms were spacious and very attractive. The complimentary breakfasts pleased our palates beyond any expectation; how about homemade, warm blueberry bread pudding! Afternoon "tea" provided us with a light and tasty array of hors d'ouevres and wine or coffee/tea and a lovely library where we enjoyed our conversation and treats after our daily activities. The staff was more than courteous and accommodating; they exhibitied a friendly manner and a willingness to help us find restaurants, limos, etc. Our tour van picked us up right in front of the hotel. When in Seattle, we will again choose the Inn at harbor Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: crewealp
Reviews.Content: What a neat place. If you like unconventional but very nice, this is the spot. The inn comprises the bottom two floors of a high rise apartment bldg. The rooms are nicely decorated with a fireplace and french doors. Although showing signs of wear such as stained or frayed carpet, it was not offensive. Everything else was very clean. An hour after check-in there was a very nice wine and cheese offering. You could enjoy your wine in the library or on the patio outside, and meet other guests. Breakfast was more than sufficient and tasty w/ fresh baked breads, cereal, an egg dish, juices, fruit, coffee, etc. The inn was a few short blocks from Pike's Market and Pioneer's Square. The staff was very friendly and helpful. After comparing prices, location and amenities - this was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise to have a hotel feel more like a luxury suite at a private estate. The room was beautifully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our balcony overlooked the harbor and access to the waterfront and all it offers as well as quick access to Pike's Market makes this hotel a sure bet for all future stays in Seattle. Security is excellent and the workout facility was first rate. The wine and cheese reception and breakfast buffet were first class--way beyond most. A real gem amongst the typical luxury hotels. We will never stay anywhere else in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Great Find”
Reviews.Author: helencaswell
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for check-in, a young man showed us around the grounds of the entire place. It's unusual because you feel you're in a modern high rise apt. or business building- and there's 2 separate bldgs. But then your room is so beautiful and cozy, like an "Inn". There's a huge garden courtyard that is very peaceful. They had 5 Star amenities- 2 saunas, a jacuzzi, fitness centers, tiny lap pool, beautiful large lap pool (both indoor) and our favorite thing- an indoor basketball court. The breakfast (aside from a very salty quiche and not-very-hot coffee) was nice. I liked the oatmeal, thick raisin toast and fresh fruits. We paid $175 for our room and around $200 for our parents. The latter room was exquisite but not as described. We thought that a "deck with a view of the water" was just that. But you had to peer around the corner to catch a glimpse of the water- disappointing. Everything though is incredibly clean and the rooms have awesome bathrooms. We did not have wi-fi but could have gotten a cable from front desk to have free DSL in our room. There are not many interesting restaurants in immediate area for dinner (more tourist-y, over-priced ones), but this hotel is lovely. You can walk to Pike Market and it's totally safe at any time of the day or night. We had one homeless person politely ask for change at 11:30pm- that was the extent of our "downtown" experience.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Inn at Harbor Steps!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a gem in the heart of Downtown Seattle. Our room was beautifully furnished and perfect. We couldn't belive how quiet it was for being in the heart of downtown Seattle. Everyone who works at the hotel went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and knew our way around. They were so friendly and helpful. This is one of our most favorite hotels. The location is great, the best in Seattle. Very easy to get around, by walking or Taxi. I never once felt unsafe. I can't say enough good things about the Inn at Harbor Steps.

Reviews.Title: “The Other Great Hotel Near Pike's Place Market”
Reviews.Author: Yabolo
Reviews.Content: My 80 year old mom and I loved the Inn at Harbor Steps. We had a huge room, helpful staff, privacy and all the fun of downtown for a really great price. It has a fabulous breakfast every morning as part of the room rate. It is not a place for people who like glitzy lobbies and all-night bars on site. It is contemporary, earthy, quietly high end. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not only is Harbor Steps right across the street from Seattle Art Museum (not a good museum at all), it's also nearby numerous strip clubs. Safety in the neighborhood is disappointing. Can't walk down the street without being verballly assaulted. There are perks, such as snack and internet, but so are other hotels. With this price range, there are better choices; such as W, right next to the Central Library. I'd prefer staying in a safer neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: malaryn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept 2005 following reviews on Trip Advisor & would thoroughly recommend it.In an ideal location & quiet. Hotel is at top of steps down to harbour front & quiet. Rooms are large, well furnished & overlook steps. Breakfasts are good with plenty of choice. Bonus is afternoon tea, coffe & wine with cake or savoury snacks included in price & served in the library.Staff on reception desk are really helpful & can recommend places of interest & restaurants. We telephoned them on arrival in Seattle & they arranged for a taxi to pick us up at the Space Needle. Another bonus in internet free access in the foyer. Would drfinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Harbor Steps exceeded our expectations, with the message passed to our restaurant that it was our anniversary and balloons at the door when we returned. The setting and location were wonderful, and the breakfasts amazing. My only issue was personal - suffering from SAD, I had trouble with the lighting in our room. We had only the dimmest of lights from the lamps, to the point that I couldn't even choose an outfit from my suitcase without checking what I had in the bathroom lights. As the majority of our stay was dark and rainy outside, the option of bright lighting in the room would have been better. But this was incredibly minor - everything else was amazing, leading us to feel pampered and relaxed even in a bustling, downtown setting.

Reviews.Title: “room at the inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we recently concluded a short but sweet holiday vacation at the inn at the harbor steps in seattle and were pleased with our experience. the holidays can be a busy, stressful time of the year for much of the service industry but the inn's staff took away all our stress and any potential stress by catering to our every whim and even our whim's whims. the cliche in real estate is location, location, location and the inn has that - or at least it did for us. the location of the inn is prime for visiting the famed pike place market [only a few blocks away] and the nearby shopping district [a few more blocks away] - which was good for our purposes of supplementing santa's gifts. the rooms were spacious and well-attended during our stay and our kids made use of the on-site pool, which was not crowded and a perfect size and depth for our 8 year-old, who loved it - we felt like we had our own private spa. an adjacent brazilian restaurant [ipanema] was reasonably priced with a fun atmosphere and superb food - overall a pleasant surprise that we had not been expecting. some middle income bracket people coming from out of market [which, admittedly, may not be the inn's target demographic] may find the inn to be a bit pricey but we have always taken the stance that you get what you pay for and in this instance - we received a thoroughly enjoyable experience far beyond the cost on paper. we would highly recommend the inn to anyone interested in having a downtown seattle location that is walking distance to many of that city's best attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review at the Inn at Harbor Steps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice room; staff was very helpful. More like an upscale hotel than a B&B. Ambience of library and breakfast room very modern, immaculate, neat; but not warm. A nice breakfast selection of quiches, cereals cooked and boxed, muffins, scones, fruit. Big pool, but too shallow even for comfortable lap swimming. Nice jaccusi, sauna.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: stevegos
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel. The reception is a bit odd as it doubles as the reception for a large number of apartments and appears to close at about 8pm. we arrived at about 10pm and there wa s porter on duty for the whole building. The room we has was on the ground floor, below street level (the street level falls away at the back so not in the basement!). The room was clan and tidy and like a small apartment with very large bathroom, and kitchen area plus seating area. Our room was a little noisy as there were coffee shops and bars nearby, but not really a problem. The location is very close to some of the attractions and about a 5 min walk to the sea front. Staff were OK and friendly. Breakfast average.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location & great staff”
Reviews.Author: meredithandmarley
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: If you are looking for a great location from which to explore Seattle, the Inn at the Harbor Steps is it. It's a quick walk to Pike Place Market, Seattle Aquarium, the downtown shopping district, Pioneer Square, and the ferries. It's also two blocks away from my favorite seafood restaurant, Elliott's. ROOMS: The rooms are extremely large - they appear to actually be studio apartment floorplans since the majority of the building is residential. Ceilings are very high with floor to ceiling glass facing the steps down to the waterfront. Beds are comfortable, there is LOTS of closet space, and a small balcony with table and chair overlooking the Harbor Steps. EXTRAS THAT MATTERED: 1) We had our two toddler daughters with us and the staff was terrific - expecially Laura at the concierge desk. 2) Included breakfast was continental, but with lots of fruit, baked items, cereal, yogurt, juice, and a wonderful egg/potato/cheese dish. 3) Parking is secure under the building with easy exit to Western Avenue via Seneca. 4) There's a Tully's Coffee and gourmet deli along The Steps in addition to a million restaurants in the neighborhood. 5) If you want to use Seattle's public transit to go to the University or East Side, it's right there. 6) The folks at the desk will let you drop off your bags early before check-in. 7) Refrigerator in the room was great for the kids. 8) There's a nice library where you can relax. 9) There are DVD machines in the rooms and a DVD library to pick from. DRAWBACKS: Our room was right by the entrance door to the Inn rooms in the building so we could hear the door closing at night as people came in and out. Overall, it was a great experience and we will be back on our next trip. NOTE: I previously lived in Seattle for 13 years, so I feel qualified to say the location is ideal and the room price ($200 per night) very reasonable for that location.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! The staff went out of their way to make our stay in Seattle wonderful. Breakfast was wonderful, all home made items. We purchased several of their cook books for holiday gifts! Room was very clean and cozy style without feeling over done. Understated, but warm. Location is the best, across the street from the Museum, and two blocks from the Market. Like most large cities, Seattle has some street people, however the hotel feels like a safe and quiet place in the middle of a the city. Never felt unsafe walking around town. Save your money and do not rent a car, we paid to have it parked the entire time in the garage and never took it out! The staff had great advice on resturants, and had all their menus! Also thanks to David at the front desk we took a ferry, just blocks away from the hotel to Bainbridge Island and had lunch, wonderful view of Seattle. This is a must to experience Seattle. This vacation/work trip has been great due to the hotel and it's friendly staff. We look forward to returning next summer and spending more time!

Reviews.Title: “Some things great, other things not so great”
Reviews.Author: BigMin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 4 nights. We are in our late twenties and a professional working couple, no kids and have never been to Seattle. LOCATION Great: Location, truly is close to everything. Not so Great: Bums and close proximity to strip clubs. ROOM Great: Noise level in rooms. Despite being next to several busy roads, the noise level was minimium if you could hear anything at all. We stayed in a whirpool tub and fireplace room, which I highly recommend if you can afford to spend the extra money. The Jacuzzi tub is fantastic. Getting the paper everyday is nice as well. Not so Great: Our room had a particular "cold" feeling to it. The room has a very high ceiling and the walls are painted stark white. It just doesn't have a "cozy" feeling. The fireplace ----. You can't turn it up or down, you just flip a switch. This may be fine for some, but in comparison to other places we have stayed, the fireplace always has had some control to it. In this case, its either ON or OFF. Our comforter had some "stains" on it when we arrived. We called the front desk and it was changed promptly. Comment: Some nights we received turn down service and some nights we didn't. One night a gentlemen came and asked if we wanted turn down, we were getting ready to leave for dinner and asked if he could come back in 15 minutes. He then became a tad forceful that the turn down was either now or never. We had 2 nights of turndown including the above and two nights with no turn down. Weird. FOOD Great: Complimentary soda and water in your room. We had a very early flight upon our departure and were offered plates in our room. Not so great: The breakfast was hardly more then a contintental breakfast. Ours for 4 straight days was, an egg quiche (which was terrible), fruit, yogurt, cold cereal, oatmeal, a variety of breads, juice, coffee, and tea. There was no variety for 4 days. For those of you that know about foods, this is a straight sugar and carb breakfast. I had read on their own website and additional reviews on this site about their "Fabulous Four Sisters Inn" breakfast. I feel that the breakfasts we experienced fell short. In addition the tea/wine hour wasn't that great either but again this is compared to our previous experiences. There was wine offered (terrible wine), cheese, crackers, and 1 - 2 kinds of tea. There weren't any pastries of any kind. Like I said, our experiences has been to either have a scone, cookie, etc offered with tea. Staff: Great: Janice and Greg were fabulous. Very kind curteous and helpful. The umbrellas were great as well. Not so Great: Other staff members. They didn't know much if at all about how to get around, restaurants etc. They kept talking to us like we were from there, using phrases like "just over there" "around the corner" Overall the stay at this hotel was "OK". I would probably venture to stay elsewhere next time, dependent on price. The greatest thing about this Inn is the location, the worst thing was the breakfast and the tea/wine hour. I paid $800 for 4 nights in their top of the line room, I don't think this stay was worth $800.

HotelInfo.Name: Inn at Harbor Steps - A Four Sisters Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1221 First Ave., Seattle, WA 98101
